alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 24 at 1:22PM PDT until March 25 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations 10 to 15 inches in the Cascades and 4 to 8 inches in the Siskiyou Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades, Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades, including Highway 62 near Union Creek and Crater Lake, Highway 230, Highway 58 at Willamette Pass and Highway 138 at Diamond Lake, Highway 140 near Lake of the Woods and the Mt Ashland Ski Road. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
